content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe on Allrecipes that includes ingredients like olives, has at least a 4-star rating, and more than 25 reviews. Detail the ingredients, cooking method, and total time required for preparation and cooking.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to search for a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe that includes olives. The search box is available at the top, so I should use it to enter the necessary keywords to find relevant recipes.
Action: Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish with olives
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.1
token: : Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish with olives

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see search results, and the images/titles of recipes are visible. To find one that fits the criteria (Mediterranean-style grilled fish, includes olives, ≥4-star rating, >25 reviews), I need to view details for the most relevant recipe. The first result, "Mediterranean Grilled Salmon Kabobs," seems promising and is the most visible fish option.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This recipe does not have any ratings or reviews ("Be the first to rate & review!"), which does not meet the task criteria. I need to go back and check other search results that might have the required number of reviews and a 4-star rating.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This is still the previous recipe, which doesn’t meet the required star rating or review count. I need to return to the search results to try the next recipe option.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There are multiple recipe options shown in the search results. The second result (center tile) "22 Top-Rated Seafood Recipes for the Mediterranean Diet" may include a collection and could contain a recipe that meets all criteria. The third result, "Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish," is a direct fish recipe and looks promising; I should check its details for ingredients, reviews, and rating.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This recipe, "Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish," has a 4.6-star rating and 57 reviews, which meets the task criteria. I now need to scroll down to locate the list of ingredients, cooking method, and total preparation and cooking time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still haven't reached the section displaying the ingredients, instructions, or total time. I need to continue scrolling down to access these recipe details.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the "Ingredients" section. Currently, only the first ingredient is visible. I need to scroll down further to see the remaining ingredients, cooking method, and total preparation/cooking time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Several ingredients are now visible, and the "Directions" section is beginning to show alongside the first step. However, I need to see the complete list of ingredients (to confirm the presence of olives), all preparation steps, and the total time required. Further scrolling is needed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The cooking directions are partially visible, specifically step 3 and part of step 4. I need to scroll a bit more to ensure I can capture the complete cooking method and look for the total time required for preparation and cooking.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section mainly displays images of the finished dish and grill, with no text showing total cook time or additional ingredients. I still need to confirm if olives are included as an ingredient and locate the total preparation and cooking time information. I should scroll up to recheck the upper part of the recipe, especially the full ingredient list.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The displayed section shows steps 3 and 4 of the cooking method but does not provide the full ingredient list or total preparation/cooking time. To gather all necessary details, including whether olives are present and time required, I need to scroll further up to access the top portion where this information is typically summarized.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current ingredients list only shows olive oil, garlic, spinach, and feta—there are no olives included, which is a critical requirement for the task. I should scroll up further or investigate if there are more ingredients above this section, as recipes may have a list that scrolls separately or continues upward.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The top of the "Ingredients" section is now visible with "1 (8 ounce) swordfish steak" shown, but there are still no olives listed. The necessary requirement for olives as an ingredient is not met by this recipe, so I should return to the search results and look for another recipe that includes olives.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back at the main recipe page for "Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish," which still does not include olives in its ingredients. I need to search again for a different recipe that is Mediterranean-style, uses olives, and meets the review and rating criteria. I should use the search bar to adjust the search query.
Action: Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish with olives
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.82
token: : Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish with olives

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for "Mediterranean grilled fish with olives" was submitted. The first recipe, "Mediterranean Grilled Salmon Kabobs," is a grilled seafood dish and may contain olives. I should check this recipe’s details for the presence of olives and the required rating and reviews.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.85

Thought: This recipe "Mediterranean Grilled Salmon Kabobs" does not meet the review and rating criteria—it has no reviews or ratings. In its preview, there is no mention of olives either. I'll need to go back to the search results and try another option.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.85

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <input> "";	[3]: <button> "Click to search";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";	[9]: "Recipes";	[10]: "BBQ & Grilling Recipes";	[11]: "Seafood";	[12]: "Skewers and Kabobs";	[13]: "Be the first to rate & review!";	[14]: "1 Photo";

Confidence: 0.99
